description: From Middle English pere (“bridge pillar”), from Medieval Latin pera, from Old Northern French pira (“breakwater”), from Vulgar Latin *petricus, from Latin petra.

entries.meaning: A raised platform built from the shore out over water, supported on piles; used to secure, or provide access to shipping; a jetty.
examples: Your boat is docked at the pier.

entries.meaning: A similar structure, especially at a seaside resort, used to provide entertainment.
examples: There is a gaming arcade on the pier.

entries.meaning: A structure supporting the junction between two spans of a bridge.
(architecture) A rectangular pillar, or similar structure, that supports an arch, wall or roof, or the hinges of a gate.
